column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=But do you ever ask yourself that question when you 're writing , " Who cares ? "
#Text=[ Laughs ]
#Text=Well , yeah .
#Text=I mean , to some degree , you have to wonder , " Who cares ? "
#Text=But you have to figure that there 's gon na be people out there who share your experience .
#Text=When writing prose you must come to terms with the fact that Oprah is the queen of the prose world right now , because women are the people who buy most literary fiction .
#Text=I 'm a guy in his fifties .
#Text=The experience of a guy in his fifties is not that interesting to women and there are n't that many men in their fifties reading serious fiction at this point .
#Text=So you do kind of box yourself into a corner .
#Text=But what can I do about that ?
#Text=I can only write about what I can write about .
#Text=There are wonderful writers out there who are mature men writing wonderful books : McEwan or Roth or whoever you want to point your finger at .
#Text=It 's just that that whole serious fiction world has its own problems .
#Text=That 's what the online bookseller started to change .
#Text=The future of the narrative
#Text=When you look at the arc of American culture , in your experience , where do you see it heading ?
#Text=Well , technology is what makes all things change .
#Text=If there were never any changes in technology , I ’m sure everything would reach a sort of stasis , and we 'd just live the same way all the time .
#Text=So , as technology changes , it 's going to feed int -- all of a sudden , there 'll be some breakthrough thing that no one will suspect .
#Text=I mean , when Quentin Tarantino came out of nowhere with Pulp Fiction , it was because of what he had accumulated as a video store guy .
#Text=I know right now , my son is on the computer every night watching endless YouTube videos , and he 's making videos himself , and he 's got the TV set on and the music on at the same time .
#Text=Maybe something 's going to come out of that .
#Text=Something that 's not apparent .
#Text=Somebody , somewhere , all of a sudden , all these elements will fuse , and there will be this new thing .
#Text=I interviewed a novelist named John Reed , who wrote this book called Snowball 's Chance that was kind of a rip on Orwell .
#Text=We were talking about how limited the current narrative is -- at least in the United States , where it 's sin , suffer and redemption .
#Text=John said he could foresee at some point these multidimensional narratives almost on a Biblical level come to fruition .
#Text=Where you have various dimensions , and where it goes from the Internet to magazines to television and it ends up spanning different mediums .
#Text=It 's an interesting idea , and when you really think about it you can see it starting to happen .
#Text=It 's not being done quite yet , but you could envision it .
